Class PlayerHand

java.lang.Object
parade.models.player.PlayerHand
public class PlayerHand extends Object
Represents a player's hand in the Parade game. A hand holds up to a fixed number of cards and supports operations like drawing, removing, and displaying cards.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    MAXHANDCOUNT
    The maximum number of cards a player can hold in hand.

    Constructs an empty PlayerHand.

    Draws one card from the given deck and adds it to the hand.
    ArrayList<Card>

    Returns the list of cards in the hand.
    int
    getHandSize()
    Returns the number of cards currently in the hand.

    Initializes the player's hand by drawing 5 cards from the deck.
    void
    removeCard(Card card)
    Removes a card from the hand.
    String
    toString()
    Returns a visual string representation of the hand, with cards displayed horizontally.

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      public void addCard(Card card)
      Adds a card to the hand if it is not full.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to add
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the hand already has MAXHANDCOUNT cards

    • removeCard

      public void removeCard(Card card) throws InvalidCardException
      Removes a card from the hand.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to remove
      Throws:
      InvalidCardException - if the card is not in the hand

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(Deck deck)
      Draws one card from the given deck and adds it to the hand. Prints a message if the deck is empty.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck to draw from

    • initHand

      public void initHand(Deck deck)
      Initializes the player's hand by drawing 5 cards from the deck.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck to draw from

      Returns:
